ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Tools for performing variable selection in three-way data using N-PLS in combination with L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores. The N-PLS model (Rasmus Bro, 1996 <DOI:10.1002/(SICI)1099-128X(199601)10:1%3C47::AID-CEM400%3E3.0.CO;2-C>) is the natural extension of PLS (Partial Least Squares) to N-way structures, and tries to maximize the covariance between X and Y data arrays. The package also adds variable selection through L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores.

Tools for performing variable selection in three-way data using N-PLS in combination with L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores. The N-PLS model (Rasmus Bro, 1996 <DOI:10.1002/(SICI)1099-128X(199601)10:1%3C47::AID-CEM400%3E3.0.CO;2-C>) is the natural extension of PLS (Partial Least Squares) to N-way structures, and tries to maximize the covariance between X and Y data arrays. The package also adds variable selection through L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores.

name: r-snpls
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0.27' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-snpls
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/sNPLS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/sNPLS/sNPLS_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7b7b3609aa88cee08901acdfe5e758d83fd5c217abfbca2fe9ea575e5b660540

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix
    - r-clickr
    - r-future
    - r-future.apply
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ks
    - r-pbapply
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix
    - r-clickr
    - r-future
    - r-future.apply
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggrepel
    - r-ks
    - r-pbapply

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('sNPLS')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('sNPLS')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sNPLS
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Tools for performing variable selection in three-way data using N-PLS in combination
    with L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores. The N-PLS model (Rasmus
    Bro, 1996 <DOI:10.1002/(SICI)1099-128X(199601)10:1%3C47::AID-CEM400%3E3.0.CO;2-C>)
    is the natural extension of PLS (Partial Least Squares) to N-way structures, and
    tries to maximize the covariance between X and Y data arrays. The package also adds
    variable selection through L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: sNPLS
# Type: Package
# Title: NPLS Regression with L1 Penalization
# Version: 1.0.27
# Author: David Hervas
# Maintainer: David Hervas <ddhervas@yahoo.es>
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: clickR, future, future.apply, ggplot2, ggrepel, ks, MASS, Matrix, pbapply
# Description: Tools for performing variable selection in three-way data using N-PLS in combination with L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores. The N-PLS model (Rasmus Bro, 1996 <DOI:10.1002/(SICI)1099-128X(199601)10:1%3C47::AID-CEM400%3E3.0.CO;2-C>) is the natural extension of PLS (Partial Least Squares) to N-way structures, and tries to maximize the covariance between X and Y data arrays. The package also adds variable selection through L1 penalization, Selectivity Ratio and VIP scores.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-12-16 10:18:46 UTC; aghil
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-12-16 12:50:02 UTC
